sentences.en: Dickens incarnated hypocrisy in his Uriah Heep.
sentences.cn: 狄更斯把虚伪体现在他塑造的人物赖亚·赫普身上.

sentences.en: European carping over the phraseology represented a mixture of hypocrisy and subterfuge.
sentences.cn: 欧洲在措词上找岔子的做法既虚伪又狡诈.

sentences.en: He accused newspapers of hypocrisy in their treatment of the story.
sentences.cn: 他指责了报纸在报道该新闻时的虚伪。

sentences.en: He railed against hypocrisy and greed.
sentences.cn: 他痛斥伪善和贪婪的行为。

sentences.en: I challenged him on the hypocrisy of his political attitudes.
sentences.cn: 我就他虚伪的政治观点质问他。

sentences.en: In the moralistic accents of today's leaders we hear echoes of a previous generation's hypocrisy.
sentences.cn: 在当今领导人的说教腔调中,我们感到了上一代人的伪善.

sentences.en: It would be sheer hypocrisy to pray for success, since I’ve never believed in God.
sentences.cn: 我从不相信上帝，因此为获成功而祈祷是纯粹的虚伪之举。

sentences.en: The baron became increasingly heated over the hypocrisy of it all.
sentences.cn: 男爵对整件事的虚伪感到越来越生气。

sentences.en: The clamour to draw a veil over the minister's extra-marital activities reeks of hypocrisy.
sentences.cn: 想要掩饰部长婚外情的喧嚣叫嚷之声让人倍感虚伪。

sentences.en: The debate in the mainstream press has been a classic example of British hypocrisy.
sentences.cn: 主流媒体上的辩论是英国式虚伪的典型例子。

sentences.en: The TV show had the whiff of hypocrisy and pomposity.
sentences.cn: 这个电视节目有些伪善和夸耀的嫌疑。

sentences.en: The whole thing reeks of hypocrisy.
There was a measure of hypocrisy and calculation in Tennie's method.
sentences.cn: 丹妮的方法显得有点虚伪,有点工于心计.

sentences.en: They left themselves wide open to accusations of double standards and hypocrisy.
sentences.cn: 他们使自己陷于被人指责搞双重标准和虚伪不实的境地。

sentences.en: You'll have little patience with the hypocrisy and double standards you encounter.
sentences.cn: 你将会无法忍受所遭遇的伪善和双重标准。

trans.tran_en: when someone pretends to have certain beliefs or opinions that they do not really have – used to show disapproval
